ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: to whoever among you wishes to go straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: For those of you who desire to walk the path that is straight,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: for everyone of you who wishes to follow the Straight Way;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: So let those who want, choose the right guidance
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: For the one among you who wishes to become upright.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: To whomsoever among you who wills to walk straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: For him among you who pleases to go straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for whosoever of you who would go straight;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to every one of you who wishes to tread the straight path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: for those of you who wish to walk straight;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (With profit) to whoever among you wills to go straight:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: To whomsoever among you who wills to walk straight,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: for whosoever of you would go straight,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: To whoever of you wills to go straight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:28] for those of you who (li-man shā’a minkum is a substitution for li’l-‘ālamīna, ‘for all worlds’, using the same preposition) wish to go straight, by following the truth;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight) to whoever wills to conform to the commands of Allah: the belief in Allah's divine Oneness and other things.
